main event: A witness observed an unidentified object appearing as a light, through binoculars, for about 90 seconds.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be 2-3 times the size of a star and was observed moving to the south at an altitude of 60 feet.
The witness had long-term research experience in electrical phenomena and had seen similar objects before, knowing over 500 people who had seen them in the area.
The witness indicated that the object did not appear to be a daylight reflection or a balloon, as concluded by the reporting group.
The witness provided a sketch showing the object's position and motion, and indicated the object's size in relation to the horizon.
The witness did not report the object to anyone at the time, but the report was filed as part of Project Blue Book.
sighted object: an unidentified object appearing as a light
